transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, Michael!

transcript.dialogue: Well, thanks, nice, nice being here, I think.

transcript.dialogue: I hope.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You hope?

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: I'm sure.

transcript.dialogue: You're sure... Okay, Michael Norman, what make you a ghost expert?

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: I'm a ghost writer. Written books, "Haunted America", "Historic Haunted America", maybe you can help me write "Haunted Universe".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm probably too busy with my show, but thank you for the offer.

transcript.dialogue: You can be my research assistant.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Too busy, I said.

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: Absolutely, absolutely. Uh, we'll have a whole chapter, on, on, on, on space ghosts.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't want a chapter, son, I want a book!

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You can call it "Portrait of Space Ghost as a Young Man". (laughs) Ahhh!

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: I'm looking for, uh, a good research assistant, somebody who could, you know, help me, and identify those places in the universe that, uh, might have some ghost stories.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Look, Mike, I'm not going to be your assistant. I host my own talk show!

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: I'll give you credit, you know, in the bibliography, I'll even put you on the...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mike, tell the universe what you know about ghosts.

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: The, uh, the ghosts of Halloween are nothing like ghosts in real life.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You don't say!

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: Ghosts exist in a, in a plane or in a time, uh, that is, when they lived, in other words, they don't exist on the same level, on the same plane that we do.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Meaning ghosts are wiser and more sophisticated than certain other beings, of course.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Geek!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Loser!

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.dialogue: So, uh... who are you again?

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: Say the question again?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, you are...

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: I'm Michael Norman...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, Michael Norman!

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Okay, Mr. Expert! Explain to the universe how it's okay that my existence defies all known laws of physics!

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: I think you'd have to explain that to me, because you're the first ghost I've ever met.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm the first ghost you've ever met? I thought you were the expert!

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: I've not seen a ghost up until today, so, uh, I suppose this is my, my scariest encounter, but it's been very benign, and a very nice encounter, uh, if, if I might say so.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Of course you may, Mr. Expert!

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: How long have you been a ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Me? (pause) Oh, thirty-odd years, give or take.

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: What caused you to be a ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um... an accident.

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: Oh. I'm sorry.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, that's okay. It was a long time ago, I'm much better... since, the accident (voice echoes)

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: Uh, what kind of an accident?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, you know. Farming.

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: A farming accident. What happened in the farming accident?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mmmm, we were farming, things got out of hand... it all happened so fast. It was horrible.

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: Okay. Uh, and, and, and now...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (emotionally distraught) I'm sorry... it's difficult for me... I'm, I'm sure you understand

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: And somehow that caused you to be... to become a ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (normal voice) You know what? It was fishing.

transcript.dialogue: It was fishing.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: A fishing accident.

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: You're not sure how you became a ghost, are you really a ghost, are you sort of making this up as you go along?

transcript.dialogue: (stifles a laugh)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I... uhh... what, you think I'm lying?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um... no.

transcript.dialogue: Well, then, I suppose you're not a living thing.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um... Oh! I mean, yes! I do! I do require oxygen!

transcript.dialogue: (sighs)

transcript.dialogue: Uhhhmmm...

transcript.dialogue: Do you mind, Zorak? I'm trying to do an interview here!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Blast him! Blast him! Blast him! Blast him! Blast him!

transcript.dialogue: Now, Zorak, violence is not the answer...

transcript.dialogue: Blast him! Blast him! Blast him! Blast him! Blblbl... Aiieeegg!! (Space Ghost blasts Zorak)

transcript.dialogue: Hey Mike, when Zorak dies, will he become a ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sometimes.

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: Okay. Well, if he's a praying mantis, then perhaps he has prepared himself for death.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (crisped) Bring it on!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He's in his own little world, Mike. Not like you and me. You and me, Mike. Nice guys! That's what we are. The same good stock.

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: I would, I would want to know, uh, what it's like being a ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, what is what like?

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: Is it lonely?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Actually, I'm the only ghost on Ghost Planet.

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman
transcript.dialogue: Oh, okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (I think...)

transcript.speaker: Michael Norman

transcript.dialogue: Oh, I've tried, I've tried.

transcript.dialogue: Uh, how, how would you do that? Would you, uh, uh, advertise somehow, or talk to your friends?

transcript.dialogue: Hmmm...

transcript.dialogue: Alright!

transcript.dialogue: Moltar, find me another expert! One that likes me this time, okay?

transcript.dialogue: Okay, please welcome my next guest, science guy Bill Nye.
